intro: Linosyris glomeruliflora, commonly known as the clustered-flower linseed plant, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellowish-green in color. Linosyris glomeruliflora is primarily cultivated for its seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil.
